thread.title: One Direction Reunites In Scrapped 'History' Music Video Ending (VIDEO)
thread.title_full: One Direction Reunites In Scrapped 'History' Music Video Ending (VIDEO)

title: One Direction Reunites In Scrapped 'History' Music Video Ending (VIDEO)
text:
One Direction Reunites In Scrapped 'History' Music Video Ending (VIDEO) 1 hour ago 
As the One Direction bandmates continue to do work on their solo endeavors, an alternate ending to the pop foursome's "History" music video has surfaced and will likely bring smiles to Directioners. { "position1" : { "type" : "artist", "id" : 687496, "name" : "One Direction" } } 
To celebrate their Video of the Year win for "History" at the BRIT Awards last week, directors Ben Winston and Gabe Turner shared cutting floor footage of the chart-toppers' very last music video. In the original clip, Liam Payne, Niall Horan , Harry Styles and Louis Tomlinson run off the screen in different directions, making the news about their hiatus all that much more real. However, this version sees the bandmates running back together, which may or may not be some serious symbolism for their future. 
Speaking with MTV News in February 2016, Winston and Turner admitted that they cut the scene because they didn't think it fit in well with the visual. "It just didn’t look that great," Turner confessed. "But there certainly wasn’t any… it wasn’t supposed to be them walking off, it was just kind of like an, “OK, see you in a bit, guys!'" A post shared by Fulwell 73 Productions (@fulwell73productions) on Feb 26, 2017 at 10:35am PST 
Photo: YouTube/One Direction
